content: Thanks for the article, you make a great point of how participating in an open source is kind of a “code quality bootcamp”. I need to do that! And what do you think are the unique benefits of other learning styles? Books / articles feel like they give you the breadth (what is possible) and depth (understanding the core concepts), while own projects reinforce what you’ve learned (muscle memory). All three are necessary, no? But what is the right mix?
